intro: Stisseria fissirostris, commonly known as the narrow-beaked stisseria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
